text: One gene , two transcripts : isolation of an alternative transcript encoding for the <extra_id_0> autoantigen La <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> SS-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> from a cDNA library of a patient with primary Sjogrens ' syndrome .
A cDNA library was prepared from peripheral blood lymphocytes of an autoimmune patient with primary Sjogrens ' syndrome .

The cDNA library was screened with the patients own autoimmune serum being monospecific for the nuclear <extra_id_0> autoantigen La <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> SS-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> .

Thereby an alternative type of <extra_id_0> La <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA was identified that differed from the known <extra_id_0> La <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA due to an exchange of the exon 1 .
Sequencing of the genomic region between the exons 1 and 2 showed that the alternative 5'-end is a part of the intron .
In addition , the presence of an alternative promoter site , which exists within the intron downstream of the exon 1 , became evident .
In consequence , the alternative <extra_id_0> La <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mRNA is the result of a promoter switching combined with an alternative splicing mechanism .

In the intron , further transcription factor binding sites , including a NF-kappa B element , were identified leading to the suggestion that the expression of the gene encoding for the nuclear <extra_id_0> autoantigen La <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> SS-B <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> alters in dependence on disease conditions .
